channel.title: 2025-08 on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in 2025-08 on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Copilot’s next edit suggestion (NES) in public preview in JetBrains
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s Next Edit Suggestions (NES) feature is now in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, enabling proactive code editing and improvement suggestions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Added support for WebP images
item.description:
GitHub has added support for WebP images on github.com and GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency. Previously, WebP uploads caused broken previews or required downloads.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports AGENTS.md custom instructions
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent now supports AGENTS.md custom instructions, allowing users to guide the agent on project understanding and how to build, test, and validate changes.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Start and track Copilot coding agent tasks from Raycast
item.description:
Raycast, a macOS launcher, now supports interaction with AI agents, including starting and tracking GitHub Copilot coding agent tasks.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improvements to the home dashboard available in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has introduced a public preview of enhancements to the home dashboard, focusing on content and layout improvements to help users track their key work status and navigation.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI GPT-5 mini is now available in public preview in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-5 mini is now publicly available in preview for GitHub Copilot users within Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — August update
item.description:
The August 2025 update for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio 2022 (v17.14) introduces a smarter Copilot powered by GPT-5, general availability of the Microsoft Copilot Platform (MCP), and enhanced user control features.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Getting Started with the Aspire CLI
item.description:
The Aspire CLI is a new tool for configuring and running applications. This article introduces how to get started with it.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Database for PostgreSQL Entra ID group login using user credentials
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server now supports Entra ID group login using user credentials in public preview on new servers. This feature aims to simplify user management and enhance security.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL updates for late-August 2025
item.description:
Azure SQL and SQL Server received updates in late August 2025, including the general availability of local SQL Server containers via the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: terraform: Policy as code, explained
item.description:
Policy as code automates the verification of compliance with IT and business requirements during infrastructure deployments, providing rapid checks within minutes or seconds.

  • Source: Terraform

item.title: github: Create sub-issues with Copilot in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now supports creating sub-issues and managing issue relationships via chat on github.com/copilot, available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review: Generally available in Xcode and new admin control
item.description:
Copilot code review is now generally available in Xcode. A new enterprise and organization setting for Copilot code review has been introduced for admins.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: EFCore.Visualizer – View Entity Framework Core query plan inside Visual Studio
item.description:
EFCore.Visualizer is a Visual Studio extension that lets developers visualize and analyze Entity Framework Core query execution plans directly inside the IDE.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore)—add shards and rebalance data
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore) now supports adding physical shards and rebalancing data as clusters scale, leveraging its elastic compute and storage capabilities.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for late-August 2025
item.description:
Azure SQL Database introduced a replication lag metric in late August 2025, enabling real-time monitoring of the recovery point objective (RPO) for Geo-DR configurations.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Schema migration is now available in Azure Database Migration Service (DMS)
item.description:
Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) now supports schema migration for Azure SQL Database, allowing users to migrate missing schema objects along with data using a simple checkbox option.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: Storm-0501’s evolving techniques lead to cloud-based ransomware
item.description:
Microsoft reports that financially motivated threat actor Storm-0501 has shifted from deploying on-premises endpoint ransomware toward cloud-based ransomware tactics, increasingly focusing on cloud-specific TTPs after previously targeting hybrid cloud environments.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: terraform: Terraform provider for Google Cloud 7.0 is now GA
item.description:
Terraform Google Cloud provider version 7.0 is now generally available, introducing ephemeral resources, write-only attributes, and enhanced validation logic.

  • Source: Terraform

item.title: github: Copilot code completion now uses the GPT-4.1 Copilot model
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s code completion feature has been upgraded to use the GPT-4.1 Copilot model, which enhances coding capabilities and includes updated training data beyond the previous knowledge cutoff.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Microsoft ranked number one in modern endpoint security market share third year in a row
item.description:
Microsoft was ranked number one in the modern endpoint security market share for the third consecutive year, according to a new IDC report, as announced on the Microsoft Security Blog.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Entra ID and RBAC support for GetAccountInfo and other supplemental APIs for Azure Storage
item.description:
Entra ID and RBAC support for several Azure Storage supplemental APIs, including GetAccountInfo and ACL management for containers, queues, and tables, is now generally available.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Custom block response code and body for Application Gateway WAF
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway WAF now publicly previews the ability to customize response status codes and bodies for blocked requests.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files short-term clones
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files introduces short-term clones in public preview, allowing instant, space-efficient read/write access by creating temporary thin clones from volume snapshots without full data copies.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: CNI Overlay for Application Gateway for Containers and AGIC
item.description:
Azure CNI Overlay for Application Gateway for Containers (AGIC) is now generally available. It allows AKS clusters to assign pod IPs from a separate CIDR, conserving VNet IP space and simplifying multi-cluster deployments.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Roslyn Analyzer for Durable Functions in .NET isolated
item.description:
The Roslyn Analyzer for Durable Functions in the .NET isolated model is now available in public preview, providing real-time code analysis to enforce durable orchestration coding constraints.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Microsoft Azure now available from cloud region in Austria
item.description:
Microsoft Azure is now generally available in a new cloud region in Austria, supporting secure data storage and processing for local companies and public administration.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Functions support for Node.js 22
item.description:
Azure Functions now generally supports Node.js 22, allowing development and deployment on all Azure Functions plans for Linux and Windows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Migrate now supports migration to disks with Zone-Redundant Storage (ZRS) redundancy
item.description:
Azure Migrate now supports migrating servers to disks with Zone-Redundant Storage (ZRS) redundancy. Users can select ZRS as the redundancy option during migration, enabling automatic provisioning of ZRS disks.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Application Gateway adds MaxSurge support for zero-capacity-impact upgrades
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway now supports MaxSurge, allowing new instances to be provisioned during rolling upgrades without taking existing instances offline. This feature enables zero-capacity-impact upgrades to newer gateway versions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally, Available: Search Job in Log Analytics - Now Supporting Up to 100 Million Results
item.description:
Azure Log Analytics’ Search Job feature is now generally available and supports returning up to 100 million results. It enables asynchronous queries across all workspace data, including long-term retention, with results delivered in Analytics tables for further analysis.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure NetApp Files file access logs
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files file access logs are now generally available, providing detailed visibility into file-level operations for SMB, NFSv4.1, and dual-protocol volumes. This feature helps organizations improve their security monitoring.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Functions Flex Consumption plan now supports 512 MB instance size and diagnostic settings
item.description:
Azure Functions Flex Consumption plan now supports a 512 MB memory instance size option, in addition to 2048 MB and 4096 MB. This update helps optimize costs for apps with lower resource needs and supports scaling.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Bastion now supports connectivity to private AKS clusters via tunneling
item.description:
Azure Bastion now supports secure tunneling to private Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters, allowing direct access to the AKS API server from local machines using standard Kubernetes tools.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files Flexible service level now supports cool access
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files’ Flexible service level now supports cool access, enabling customers to configure storage capacity and throughput independently for workloads with specific performance and sizing needs.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Private Preview: DCesv6 and ECesv6 series confidential VMs with Intel® TDX
item.description:
Azure has introduced the DCesv6 and ECesv6 series Confidential VMs powered by 5th Gen Intel Xeon processors with Intel TDX for enhanced security.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: Retirement: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Deprecation in Microsoft Azure Operated by 21Vianet Announcement
item.description:
Microsoft is retiring Microsoft Defender for Cloud in the Azure operated by 21Vianet environment due to increasing infrastructure and operational complexity.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: Retirement: Microsoft Sentinel Deprecation in Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet Announcement
item.description:
Microsoft Sentinel in Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet is being deprecated due to increasing infrastructure and operational complexity.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Blob Storage Archive Tier Now in Malaysia West
item.description:
The Azure Blob Storage Archive access tier is now generally available in the Malaysia West region, enabling cost-effective storage of infrequently accessed data locally.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Files provisioned v2 billing model for SSD (premium)
item.description:
Azure Files has introduced the provisioned v2 billing model for its SSD (premium) tier, allowing separate provisioning of storage, IOPS, and throughput.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Databricks connector for Microsoft Power Platform
item.description:
The Azure Databricks connector for Microsoft Power Platform is now generally available, enabling seamless integration between Azure Databricks and Power Apps.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore) encryption with customer-managed key
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore) now supports encryption with customer-managed keys in public preview, adding to the existing service-managed key encryption.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra v5.0
item.description:
Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra now supports Cassandra 5.0 in public preview, enabling access to the latest features such as improved performance and new indexing capabilities without infrastructure management.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Database for PostgreSQL flexible server in Malaysia West
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL flexible server is now generally available in the Malaysia West Azure region.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Deployment resumption - Azure Automation revised Service and Subscription limits
item.description:
Azure Automation will resume deploying revised Service and Subscription limits starting August 11, 2025, to ensure fair resource distribution and improve reliability and performance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Announcing Tenant-Level Service Health Alerts in Azure Monitor
item.description:
Azure Monitor now offers Tenant-Level Service Health Alerts in preview, allowing notifications for service health issues affecting the entire tenant rather than single subscriptions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Introducing Azure App Testing: Scalable End-to-end App Validation
item.description:
Azure App Testing is now in public preview, allowing developers and QA teams to perform large-scale functional and performance tests across frameworks such as Playwright, JMeter, and Locust.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: App Service Inbound IPv6 Support
item.description:
Azure App Service now generally supports inbound IPv6 for multi-tenant apps across all public regions on Basic, Standard, Premium SKUs, Functions Consumption, Functions Elastic Premium, and Logic Apps Standard.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Upsert and Script Activity in Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse Analytics for Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description:
Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse Analytics now generally support the Upsert method and Script activity for Azure Database for PostgreSQL, enabling efficient and scalable data operations.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Private Application Gateway on Azure Application Gateway v2
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway v2 now generally available with Private Application Gateway features, enhancing network exposure control.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure 128 & 192 vCPU sizes for the Esv6 and Edsv6 series VMs
item.description:
Azure has launched new VM sizes in the Esv6 and Edsv6 series offering up to 192 vCPUs and 1832 GiB RAM, targeting enterprise-scale workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Data Box Next Gen is now generally available in additional regions
item.description:
Azure Data Box Next Gen is now generally available in additional regions including Australia, Japan, Singapore, Brazil, Hong Kong, UAE, Switzerland, and Norway. Both the 120TB and 525TB Azure Data Box models are generally available in these regions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Storage Discovery
item.description:
Azure Storage Discovery is now in public preview, offering enterprise-wide visibility into Azure Storage data. It enables deep analysis of capacity and activity to optimize costs, enhance security, and improve operations.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Agentic experience for AKS in the Azure CLI
item.description:
Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) is introducing an AI-powered CLI feature called “az aks agent” that integrates agentic reasoning into the Azure CLI for developers and operators.

  • Source: Azure Updates
